title: Islamic State
summary: Islamic State (official name since June 2014;[100] abbreviated IS), at times known as the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL; /ˈaɪsəl, ˈaɪsɪl/), and as the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria (ISIS; /ˈaɪsɪs/),[101] or by its Arabic acronym, Daesh (داعش, Dāʿish, IPA: [ˈdaːʕɪʃ]),[102] is a militant Sunni Islamist group and former unrecognized quasi-state[103] that follows a Salafi jihadist doctrine.[104] Islamic State was founded by Abu Musab al-Zarqawi and gained global prominence in 2014 when it drove Iraqi security forces out of key cities in its Western Iraq offensive,[105] followed by its capture of Mosul[106] and the Sinjar massacre.[107]
